findings.rationale: The ability for either party to terminate the agreement with just 30 days notice could lead to unexpected disruptions in service.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice for any reason.

findings.rationale: Limiting liability to the total fees paid may leave significant exposure for damages not covered by the indemnification clause.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total fees paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual subscription fees may not cover all potential damages incurred from breaches.
findings.evidence_quote: each party indemnifies the other for its own breach, capped at annual subscription fees.

findings.rationale: Confidentiality obligations lasting only 18 months may not be sufficient depending on the nature of the information shared.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 18 months after termination.
